t: Proverbs 12
Whoso*p loveth instruction loveth knowledge: but he that hateth reproof is brutish.
A*p good man obtaineth favour of the Lord:*s but a man of wicked devices will he condemn.
A*p man shall not be established by wickedness: but the root of the righteous shall not be moved.
A*p virtuous woman is a crown to her husband: but she that maketh ashamed is as rottenness in his bones.
The*p thoughts of the righteous are right: but the counsels of the wicked are deceit.
The*p words of the wicked are to lie in wait for blood: but the mouth of the upright shall deliver them.
The*p wicked are overthrown, and are not: but the house of the righteous shall stand.
A*p man shall be commended according to his wisdom: but he that is of a perverse heart shall be despised.
He*p that is despised, and hath a servant, is better than he that honoureth himself, and lacketh bread.
A*p righteous man regardeth the life of his beast: but the tender mercies of the wicked are cruel.
He*p that tilleth his land shall be satisfied with bread: but he that followeth vain persons is void of understanding.
The*p wicked desireth the net of evil men: but the root of the righteous yieldeth fruit.
The*p wicked is snared by the transgression of his lips: but the just shall come out of trouble.
A*p man shall be satisfied with good by the fruit of his mouth: and the recompence of a man's hands shall be rendered unto him.
The*p way of a fool is right in his own eyes: but he that hearkeneth unto counsel is wise.
A*p fool's wrath is presently known: but a prudent man covereth shame.
He*p that speaketh truth sheweth forth righteousness: but a false witness deceit.
There*p is that speaketh like the piercings of a sword: but the tongue of the wise is health.
The*p lip of truth shall be established for ever: but a lying tongue is but for a moment.
Deceit*p is in the heart of them that imagine evil: but to the counsellors of peace is joy.
There*p shall no evil happen to the just: but the wicked shall be filled with mischief.
Lying*p lips are abomination to the Lord:*s but they that deal truly are his delight.
A*p prudent man concealeth knowledge: but the heart of fools proclaimeth foolishness.
The*p hand of the diligent shall bear rule: but the slothful shall be under tribute.
Heaviness*p in the heart of man maketh it stoop: but a good word maketh it glad.
The*p righteous is more excellent than his neighbour: but the way of the wicked seduceth them.
The*p slothful man roasteth not that which he took in hunting: but the substance of a diligent man is precious.
In*p the way of righteousness is life; and in the pathway thereof there is no death.
